verses.text_plain: Who is this that cometh from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah? this that is glorious in his apparel, travelling in the greatness of his strength? I that speak in righteousness, mighty to save.
verses.verse_html:
1Who is this that cometh from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah? this that is glorious in his apparel, travelling in the greatness of his strength? I that speak in righteousness, mighty to save. ▼
▼ glorious: Heb. decked

verses.text_plain: Wherefore art thou red in thine apparel, and thy garments like him that treadeth in the winefat?
verses.verse_html: 2Wherefore art thou red in thine apparel, and thy garments like him that treadeth in the winefat?

verses.text_plain: I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the people there was none with me: for I will tread them in mine anger, and trample them in my fury; and their blood shall be sprinkled upon my garments, and I will stain all my raiment.
verses.verse_html: 3I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the people there was none with me: for I will tread them in mine anger, and trample them in my fury; and their blood shall be sprinkled upon my garments, and I will stain all my raiment.

tokens.text: with me: for I will tread

verses.text_plain: For the day of vengeance is in mine heart, and the year of my redeemed is come.
verses.verse_html: 4For the day of vengeance is in mine heart, and the year of my redeemed is come.

verses.text_plain: And I looked, and there was none to help; and I wondered that there was none to uphold: therefore mine own arm brought salvation unto me; and my fury, it upheld me.
verses.verse_html: 5And I looked, and there was none to help; and I wondered that there was none to uphold: therefore mine own arm brought salvation unto me; and my fury, it upheld me.

verses.text_plain: And I will tread down the people in mine anger, and make them drunk in my fury, and I will bring down their strength to the earth.
verses.verse_html: 6And I will tread down the people in mine anger, and make them drunk in my fury, and I will bring down their strength to the earth.

verses.text_plain: I will mention the lovingkindnesses of the Lord, and the praises of the Lord, according to all that the Lord hath bestowed on us, and the great goodness toward the house of Israel, which he hath bestowed on them according to his mercies, and according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.
verses.verse_html: 7I will mention the lovingkindnesses of the Lord, and the praises of the Lord, according to all that the Lord hath bestowed on us, and the great goodness toward the house of Israel, which he hath bestowed on them according to his mercies, and according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.

tokens.text: according to all that the Lord
on them according to his mercies

verses.text_plain: For he said, Surely they are my people, children that will not lie: so he was their Saviour.
verses.verse_html: 8For he said, Surely they are my people, children that will not lie: so he was their Saviour.

verses.text_plain: In all their affliction he was afflicted, and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bare them, and carried them all the days of old.
verses.verse_html: 9In all their affliction he was afflicted, and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bare them, and carried them all the days of old.

verses.text_plain: But they rebelled, and vexed his holy Spirit: therefore he was turned to be their enemy, and he fought against them.
verses.verse_html: 10But they rebelled, and vexed his holy Spirit: therefore he was turned to be their enemy, and he fought against them.

verses.text_plain: Then he remembered the days of old, Moses, and his people, saying, Where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of his flock? where is he that put his holy Spirit within him?
verses.verse_html:
11Then he remembered the days of old, Moses, and his people, saying, Where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of his flock? where is he that put his holy Spirit within him? ▼
▼ shepherd: or, shepherds

verses.text_plain: That led them by the right hand of Moses with his glorious arm, dividing the water before them, to make himself an everlasting name?
verses.verse_html: 12That led them by the right hand of Moses with his glorious arm, dividing the water before them, to make himself an everlasting name?

verses.text_plain: That led them through the deep, as an horse in the wilderness, that they should not stumble?
verses.verse_html: 13That led them through the deep, as an horse in the wilderness, that they should not stumble?

verses.text_plain: As a beast goeth down into the valley, the Spirit of the Lord caused him to rest: so didst thou lead thy people, to make thyself a glorious name.
verses.verse_html: 14As a beast goeth down into the valley, the Spirit of the Lord caused him to rest: so didst thou lead thy people, to make thyself a glorious name.

verses.text_plain: Look down from heaven, and behold from the habitation of thy holiness and of thy glory: where is thy zeal and thy strength, the sounding of thy bowels and of thy mercies toward me? are they restrained?
verses.verse_html:
15Look down from heaven, and behold from the habitation of thy holiness and of thy glory: where is thy zeal and thy strength, the sounding of thy bowels and of thy mercies toward me? are they restrained? ▼
▼ the sounding: or, the multitude

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the sounding: or, the multitude

verses.text_plain: Doubtless thou art our father, though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Israel acknowledge us not: thou, O Lord, art our father, our redeemer; thy name is from everlasting.
verses.verse_html:
16Doubtless thou art our father, though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Israel acknowledge us not: thou, O Lord, art our father, our redeemer; thy name is from everlasting. ▼
▼ our redeemer…: or, our redeemer from everlasting is thy name

footnotes.body_text: ▼ our redeemer…: or, our redeemer from everlasting is thy name
footnotes.body_html: ▼ our redeemer…: or, our redeemer from everlasting is thy name

verses.text_plain: O Lord, why hast thou made us to err from thy ways, and hardened our heart from thy fear? Return for thy servants’ sake, the tribes of thine inheritance.
verses.verse_html: 17O Lord, why hast thou made us to err from thy ways, and hardened our heart from thy fear? Return for thy servants’ sake, the tribes of thine inheritance.

tokens.text: why hast thou made us to err

verses.text_plain: The people of thy holiness have possessed it but a little while: our adversaries have trodden down thy sanctuary.
verses.verse_html: 18The people of thy holiness have possessed it but a little while: our adversaries have trodden down thy sanctuary.

verses.text_plain: We are thine: thou never barest rule over them; they were not called by thy name.
verses.verse_html:
19We are thine: thou never barest rule over them; they were not called by thy name. ▼
▼ they…: Heb. thy name was not called upon them

tokens.text: over them; they were not called

footnotes.body_text: ▼ they…: Heb. thy name was not called upon them
footnotes.body_html: ▼ they…: Heb. thy name was not called upon them
